page.title: 10JARROW CENTRE
page.content: The central area of Jarrow houses a large shopping complex which was opened in 1961 on a slum clearance site.It is a compact centre with a large car-park on the south side.The shops are arranged along broad traffic free precincts. Since its opening, there have been many changes in the businesses.The highest block now houses the D.H.S.S.office and a large supermarket.There were four large furniture shops but today there is only one.Beside the shopping centre there is a large bronze statue of the Vikings erected to commemorate the time in Jarrow's history when Viking invaders sacked the town and its monastery. Opposite the shopping precinct on the north side stands the old town hall which is now the education office.
